entry.summary: jackd setup with kde

content.p: acorn masterkey 49 midi controller, akai mpd18 compact pad controller

I always looking to try something new. I have been having problems with my Arch Linux install. D-Bus was crashing at least once an hour, it was becomming horibly inconvient, then I issued a pacman -Syu (system upgrade), and wasnt able to login anymore. This was really messed up actually, I got a login prompt but it never asked me for my password. Anyway, I didnt have a arch install image on my data key so I thought I would try something else. I did have a debian install image, so I am back with debian.

One difference this time around is that I have had enough with gnome. Sorry, I can not take it anymore. Pulse audio does not work well enough with midi applications, that I need. I have installed kde and disabled kmix on the startup and created a shell script to start jackd.
there is no guarantee what device will be first in alsa so we have to use the hardware device name when starting jackd.
reference: http://james.ahlstrom.name/alsa_names.html
content.h2: Step 1. Determine the name of your output sound card using aplay -l

code.pre:
darrell@debdd:~$ aplay -l
**** List of PLAYBACK Hardware Devices **** card 0: PCH [HDA Intel PCH], device 0: ALC892 Analog [ALC892 Analog] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 0: PCH [HDA Intel PCH], device 1: ALC892 Digital [ALC892 Digital] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 3: CA0106 [CA0106], device 0: ca0106 [CA0106] Subdevices: 0/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 3: CA0106 [CA0106], device 1: ca0106 [CA0106] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 3: CA0106 [CA0106], device 2: ca0106 [CA0106] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 3: CA0106 [CA0106], device 3: ca0106 [CA0106] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 4: NVidia [HDA NVidia], device 3: HDMI 0 [HDMI 0] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 4: NVidia [HDA NVidia], device 7: HDMI 0 [HDMI 0] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 4: NVidia [HDA NVidia], device 8: HDMI 0 [HDMI 0] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0 card 4: NVidia [HDA NVidia], device 9: HDMI 0 [HDMI 0] Subdevices: 1/1 Subdevice #0: subdevice #0

content.p: There may be quite a few choices, I have 2 soundcards and a hdmi out, so there are many choices. I use CA0106, its a pci card that is soundblaster compatable (i think). So this is the name of my soundcard.
content.h2: Step 2. Create a script to start jackd
content.p: I just use the default settings and i have found that this works best. Change hw:CA0106 to the name of your card determined in step 1. hw:0 or hw:1 can be problematic.
content.h2: Step 3. Start jackd on startup of X
content.p: this will be different depending on your desktop environment, but i recomend something that does not require pulse to start with anyway. i use kde. you could also use your .xinitrc if that file is used on your startup.

i can not explain this better than what is out there, being less than an expert i just used what works. I have tried hw:0 and hw:1 in the mixer section and havent figured out if it makes a difference. if you google search: use jackd with flash plugin, you will get this... here is the ~/.asoundrc
content.h2: Step 5. Tell your desktop to use jack instead of directly to alsa
content.p: System Settings, Multimedia, Phonon. Find the device named jack and click prefer until it is at the top. Test by loging out and loging back in. Oops, I have Music selected here, but should be Audio Playback, then click Apply Device List To ... and select all.
content.h2: Step 6. QJackctl to attach midi devices
content.p: there are a bunch of youtube videos out there for this. when you run qjackctrl with this setup we are using a jackd that has already been started. so the start button should be disabled. if it isnt, well, you probably did not have sound in your test last step. you can double check jackd is running with:
then click connect in qjackctl to connect your midi devices to the sythesizer applications ... in this case i am connecting my keyboard to zynaddsubfx and my drum pad to hydrogen
Enjoy your music!

entry.title: designr8.com newsletter
entry.summary: the reason why i havent been blogging ...

content.p: you know you get on a role doing something, then it gets broken up, by hopefully something else equally productive, and it feels good, then after a while you can go back to what it was you where doing before, and you've forgoten a few things, but you find your legs again, then switch again, and of course you've forgotten a few things, but then something happens, it becomes easier and easier to switch and wear different hats. i guess its called learning.

under the category of learning how little you know and making it a good thing, i discovered recently i know only some very surface stuff about JPA, java persistance something, and i had been using it for projects quite remarkably, considering how little i knew. then of course i hit a road block in a project, because i got some unexpected behavior. i tried to solve it by growing my knowledge of this 'robust' database platform, and struggled. i'd like to share the details, but lets justs say its really not that interesting, and i still havent gone back and found out what was wrong totally, so there is no point.
the point is, sometimes a road block is exactly what you need to find a whole new approach to a problem
so i ditched jpa for some socalled 'low level api' which is basically a glorified hashtable, in the process i lost a lot of things i really didnt need

what is good about databases is the query language, gql, a dumbed down sql with limited joins, and the ability to modify records by selecting just them and making the changes and calling persist, that kind of data isolation is really nice, but it turns out, not always necasary

when i decided to ditch the robust database for this simple hashtable, i discovered i could do a lot of preprocessing and essentially have the data ready to use, rather than the database aproach of having something totally dynamic
sure the result is something more static, but it actually does everything required and is WAY faster
i will try to make a comparison with the work flow, maybe that is called a use case, cant remember that compsci stuff;)

ol.li: administrator adds data to a data store
web designer builds pages that can use parameters to query the database and display results
user chooses what data she would like to see
web page connects to the database
database returns the data to the servlet
servlet formats / renders a page with the data
programer designs a way to process a blob of data from an external source
data gets processed on without being stored generating all the possible web pages needed
user chooses data she would like to see
servlet returns the right formated web page

content.p: the big difference is when the web page is built, in the second way, all the possible pages are made in advance. i should also say that using the database way, it is also possible to store pre processed requests, in fact that is what memcache is for, and i use that strategy to speed up the database way as well

so where did we start off? i was rambling vaguely about how i would leave something, and comeback to it, gaining understanding each time you switch, despite feeling a bit clumsy when you first jump back and forth

that ramble is basically what its like to wear different hats in your life, i wear a lot of different hats, and each time is switch i seem to have to wait for the 'ah ha' moments where i realize, hey i know what i am doing here.
i think the breaks between wearing those hats allows you to step back and develop a whole new approach the next time you put on that hat again

for me, ditching jpa, for appengine datastore api was never obvious, until i stepped away for sometime, did a bunch of painting, ... well from the perspective of reading my blog, it looks like i was absent, but really i was figuring out a few things for topnotchgames.ca - you can check out the source code on my github
oh, that painting above, is totally unrelated to this article, i made it and it never got used so, i thought i would just put it up - that is steven layton from stevenlaytonsphotography.ca

entry.title: OpenDNS Family Shield
entry.summary: Protecting your family online with OpenDNS
entry.content:
DNS for dummies
DNS stands for Domanin Name Server
DNS is what the internet uses to locate websites, it is a directory
The internet is a collection of computers with addresses, just like a city is a collection of houses with addresses
Computers understand ip addresses that look like phone numbers. eg:
$ nslookup opendns.com
Server: 208.67.222.123
Address: 208.67.222.123#53
Non-authoritative answer:
Name: opendns.com
Address: 67.215.92.211
The nslookup command is asking where do I find the computer that OpenDNS.com uses to serve its website. The answer is called the Address. Your computer uses this address to get the website.
There are a number of ways to block adult content on your computers. FamilyShield by OpenDNS can be a solution for your entire network that does not require software on each computer. It can be set for all computers on your network by your modem or router. Aternatively, it can be used on each computer.
How it Works
Your default network configuration gets its DNS from your internet providers DHCP server. DHCP stands for Dynamic Host Control Protocol, which basically sets up your computers address, so content can find you when you request it AND your DNS, so you can find the content when you request it. >
Internet Service Providers (ISP) do not restrict what types of content it will allow you to search for in anyway. It is possible for you to replace your ISPs DNS with a filtering DNS, like OpenDNS FamilyShield DNS.
OpenDNS Family shield is a DNS, but it does not give you the address of sites that are on its list of inappropriate websites. When a request is made for adult content, the computer is directed to a page that indicates that site is blocked.
Advantages of OpenDNS
No extra software on your computer
Results are independent of browser choice (works for all browsers)
Community maintained list of inappropriate sites, thousands of users use this service
Can be configured for a network wide solution on your router
Difficult to bypass (impossible from the browser)
Free
Disadvantages of OpenDNS
Marginally adult content on sites that contain mostly moderated content is not filtered; for instance YouTube
Only as good as its block list; new sites are always appearing, though it can guess that these sites should be blocked based on its active directory management
Not a replacement for supervised internet usage, essentially because of YouTube there is no replacement as good as adult supervised internet use
Requires knowledge of your systems to change your DNS settings (one time only)
https://store.opendns.com/familyshield/setup/

content.p: info before rant i guess. The unix date command its the defacto representation of dates because it is ubiquitous. entry.title: xfce dual monitor with onboard video card

link.href: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=xfce dual monitor with onboard video card

entry.id: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=xfce dual monitor with onboard video card
entry.summary: How to setup dual monitors on xfce4 with one crappy onboard video card that has hdmi

content.p: I have a middle of the road onboard video card on my comptuer, but it has both hdmi and vga outputs. This is how I managed to get dual head on my computer, this really rocks.

Hopefully you know what your monitor resolution should be, if not find out before you plug both in. Once you know what your desired resolution for each monitor will be plug them both in. Now logout and login. Now run arandr, but you will have perhaps some resolution problems because the default is to have both monitors the same resolution and displaying the same thing.

ol.li: Set the resolution for your desired monitors from the outputs menu.
Drag the rectangle with the same label as your right monitor to the right of the rectangle representing your left monitor.
Select apply.
Repeat until satisfied

content.h2: Add to xfce4 startup and modify .xinitrc

ol.li: select Layout -> save as. Create a file that you will be able to remember, for me i used /home/dd/sbin/dualmon.sh
chmod +x dualmon.sh
add dualmon.sh to your xfce4 startup. Application Menu -> Settings -> Session and Startup
this totally breaks the script called startxfce4 unfortunately, so, the best way to fix this is ... (hehe this is so dirty) edit your .xinitrc file in your home directory like this:

code.pre:
#!/bin/sh # # ~/.xinitrc # # Executed by startx (run your window manager from here)
if [ -d /etc/X11/xinit/xinitrc.d ]; then for f in /etc/X11/xinit/xinitrc.d/*; do [ -x "$f" ] && . "$f" done unset f fi exec /bin/sh /etc/xdg/xfce4/xinitrc

content.p: I am sure there is a good reason why startxfce4 sets up some environment variables and does a bunch of checks, but it must not apply to me, because this works fine.
Enjoy the screen real estate!!

entry.title: Linux so I can Work - My Arch Linux Setup

link.href: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=Linux so I can Work - My Arch Linux Setup

entry.id: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=Linux so I can Work - My Arch Linux Setup
entry.summary: Arch Linux setup

content.p: Well I've resisted flaunting my Arch Linux Setup for sometime. After reading a blog on how the Linux Desktop is dead I have to stand up and object vehemently.

First of all, I should say that I have been using Linux since the mid 90's. Slackware was the first distro I became comfortable with, then I migrated to Debian, then to Ubuntu, and then back to Slackware, and finally I am now using Arch Linux.

Arch Linux is very much Like Slackware with Slackbuilds. I find that the package management is just a little smoother, because there are more binary packages and it seems a little smoother. I should mention that I do not use pacman, the default package manager, I use yaourt, but it is rare that I install stuff from the AUR repositories, so pacman is fine for most cases.

Package management, boot loader configuration and system configuration are what define a Linux Distribution. Arch Linux is very straight forward and well documented and has been a pleasure to maintain.
After a basic install Arch Linux has virtually nothing. Perfect!
I recomend learing how to setup yaourt to add packages. Here we will add what we need:

ul.li: xfdesktop : background and folders on the desktop

code.pre: $ yaourt -S slim xfce4-session xfdesktop xfwm4 xfce4-panel terminal xfce4-taskmanager $ yaourt xfce4-goodies

content.p: I am fond of using slim as the x11 startup manager to do this change the default run level in /etc/inittab to 5, then add the login line to your /etc/inittab

code.pre:
#somewhere near start of inittab: # Boot to X11 id:5:initdefault:
#somewhere near bottom of inittab: # lines for starting a login manager x:5:respawn:/usr/bin/slim

content.p: though slim does have a mechanism to select desktops with the f2 key, i did not figure out how to setup multiple desktop and reverted to the old school xinitrc method. to do this we will edit ~/.xinitrc
enjoy! if you have problems with the setup of slim / xfce4, to retest your setup you do not need to reboot your system. simply login as root by pressing alt+f1, issue the command

entry.title: HDR photography on Android Ice Cream Sandwich

link.href: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=HDR photography on Android Ice Cream Sandwich

entry.id: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=HDR photography on Android Ice Cream Sandwich
entry.summary: Quick guide to HDR on latest Android - HTC One X

content.p: HDR is kindof a new technique to get inferior cameras to create photos with a wider range of contrast. It gives photos a more real look. There are some drawbacks to HDR as well.

HDR combines 3 images, a regular image with one over exposed and one under exposed. The dark areas of the over exposed image are emphasised while the light areas of the under exposed image are emphasised.
Firstly, finding the HDR setting on the Android is not difficult. When you are in the camera, tap the A in the top left corner and scroll to find the choice from the various camera modes.

Because 3 images are required the shot is not as quick as a regular photo, so you have to hold the camera very still and there should be very little movement of major objects in the forefront of the photo. HDR is not well suited for shots that are very far away because the slightest movement of the camera is exagerated by the distance and the effect does not work, everything will appear to have a slight shadow.
Ok, lets look at 2 photos, one taken with a regular setting, then the second with HDR.

entry.title: Flowers in MyPaint
entry.summary: Flowers using Ramon R-S Web blend brush in MyPaint for Linux.

content.p: No matter how long I worked on this painting I could always find problems with it. There was just too many things that looked the same and had no real contrast, so everything looked fake. Then I decided that the point of the picture was not to make the green bits look real, but rather just focus on some contrast to get the flowers to pop off the screen. This turned out to be a difficult thing to do with a blending brush, and I was tempted to switch brushes for certain parts, but I stuck with Ramon R-S wet blend. There was a lot of filling in on this painting so a blend brush is good for that, but it is hard to get the blend brush to keep the colours lively, because they all just get murky. I also had a white background to start and this made the initial opacity of the brush to be greyish, so I found myself painting over painted areas, so, after a while i was filling with a fat brush to get a background gist and then a finer brush to get a bit of detail. Not the most enjoyable painting I've ever done just because it was hard not to want to make it look realistic, something I want to get away from.

entry.id: http://www.designr8.com/blog?title=Using ffmpeg to capture your desktop
entry.summary: Capture your desktop using ffmpeg

content.p: Captureing your desktop is useful for creating tutorials. I've discovered that a lot of people have trouble following directions given in text, and if they see how easy it really is, a lot of the confusion simply dissapears. For instance, this tutorial could be summed up by providing a one line command, but does it really help someone that is not versed in command line?
ffmpeg works on windows, linux, and likely mac.
step 1: determine the name of your screen (follows -i on step 3)
step 2: determine the resolution of your screen (follows -s on step 3)
step 3: test the ffmpeg command (no audio)
step 4: stop the recording by pressing q
step 5: test the recording
step 6: save the command in a text file and run it from a console other than the one you want to capture
content.code: echo "ffmpeg -f x11grab -r 30 -s 1360X768 -i :0.0 -vcodec libx264 -vpre lossless_ultrafast -threads 0 -y embed.mkv" > scast.command
content.p: step 7: arrange your desktop and then drop to a console by pressing Alt+f1
step 8: source the saved command (use the file name from step6)
step 9: switch back to x session with Alt+leftarrow
step 10: do your tutorial and end it with Alt+f1, then q
step 11: login to youtube and upload screencast. youtube restricts videos be less than 15 minutes.
step 12: embed your video into a webpage

entry.title: Printing Address Cards for Thunderbird
entry.summary: Beginners Guide to CSV, XML, C++, XSL, and CSS

ul.li: Motivation for printing Contacts, and issues with using default printouts
The nature of exported contact files – csv from Thunderbird
The advantages and nature of XML
Processing text files with C++ in Linux and Windows
Using XSL and CSS to display custom contact cards

content.p: There are many ways to keep a list of your contacts, but the most convenient is the address book feature in your email program. Email programs or services often automatically gather contact information of the people you know. It is useful to add as much information as you like to the contact file, even birthdays and hobbies. Though I personally do not use printouts, I have had a request from a user who is unhappy with the way Thunderbird prints out the contacts. Looking further into this issue I discovered that the printouts from many contact management places lack sophistication and waste paper. So I have made a quick fix for now that could possibly lead to some sort of web based contact management system that supports many types of printing, including standard labels. For now, I focused on printing something to travel with or keep on your desk to be used if the computer is off on a standard page (a4).

CSV stands for comma separated values, which means that each line represents one entry or contact and all the fields are separated by commas. This is a common format that most programs can export – Outlook, Mozilla Thunderbird, Excel, and Gmail to name a few. You will need a good text editor for this whole tutorial, I recommend Scite http://www.google.com/search?q=download+SciTE. When you open a csv file in a text editor you will see the first line has column or field names, followed by the data lines. Each line represents one contact, and the values are parallel to the field names in the first line. Two commas beside each other means no data for that field. If a field value has a comma in it the value must be quoted.

The reason csv is so lousy is that you can not use advanced markup languages to select fields and perform formatting to target web browsers. Once we convert the csv to xml we will be in a much better spot to format the output. This is not a tutorial on XML, there is a tonne of information on XML, I recommend http://www.w3schools.com to start, and http://zvon.org as a reference. If you are new to the subject do not bother going there yet, just have a look at the sample files to get an idea of the difference. XML caveats

Comments in XML are surrounded by <!-- and -->, they are ignored by the browser. XML values have special characters. Those characters are: &,<,>,”,' The tactic used by XML is instead of surrounding values that contain the special characters in some way, we replace the characters with a character sequence that represents the special character.

Another caveat is that XML field names can not have a space in them, so we can eliminate or replace the spaces in field names. Also, within an XML file you can refer to other files that will transform it so that it is displayable. Each file serves a purpose – The XML file holds data without display formatting, the XSL (or transformation file) holds instructions to encapsulate the data in bare HTML without any style. And finally the CSS page applies styles to the HTML, which controls things like spacing, margins, colors, block flow and page breaks. This decoupling has an advantage in that to make a change in the appearance you do not have to grok a huge monolithic program, everything is divided up. So if we decide to provide alternative formatting we will not have to change our C++ code, only our CSS.
content.h2: Using C++ to transform CSV to XML
content.p: Perhaps there are thousands of ways to do this job. But I instinctively use C++ because that is what I think in. If your first programming language was something else you probably wont even have kept reading. Carefully choosing what languages to learn early on is important, but not critical. Most languages have similar features. C++ is not alone in being widely supported, lots of free compilers, and standardized across different platforms. C++ is rarely used for internet applications though. This C++ program is about as simple as they come without being trivial. So lets get the tools and try some coding. If you are totally new to programming that is fine. What we are doing is using a text editor to write the program, a compiler to convert the program into an executable, and the operating system to feed the CSV file into the program as data. Obtain g++ for your system
MS Windows download and install Mingw http://www.google.com/search?q=download+mingw. Linux use this command

You can goto http://www.cplusplus.com/ for a reference and other beginner tutorials. As mentioned a compiler transforms a text file into something that can execute. There are languages that this is done dynamically without the compile step, like a bash script. All you need to know is how to make folders or directories, navigate to them, create a text file in the directory and save it. This article does not cover that see http://www.google.com/search?q=bash+basics if you are lost right now. Note: if you are using Mingw or Cygwin with SciTE, your home folders at the bash prompt are not the same directory as they would be at the windows command prompt (cmd) – for instance, my mingw home is c:\mingw\msys\1.0\home\darrell in windows, but is simply /home/darrell in the mingw bash shell. You can use either shell, but its easier to use the mingw shell because you wont have to add g++ to your PATH in cmd.

download the tar.gz, it contains:
contact-cards-tbird-cvs.cpp
contact-cards.xsl
contact-cards.css
thunderbird.csv
... then extract the files and change into the folder
Open the files in Scite or any plain text editor. Then to compile and execute:
or just view the result here (use firefox it supports xsl) contact-cards.xml
Open the file contact-cards.xml in a text editor and Firefox to view the result. To view the html, use the menu (File, Save as) in Firefox and open that file in a text editor.

ul.li: Comments in C++ are for the programmer to explain what is happening
Programs can be divided up into logical units using functions
Variables are blocks of memory that hold values
Values come in two flavors, primitive and objects
Primitaves are small values that usually are used to control logic of your program, whereas Objects usually represent the data and can be complex
All primative data types start with a lowercase letter, and usually Object data types start with an Uppercase letter.

content.p: We will rely heavily on the most useful object in C++ which is the String or String class. A string is a sequence of characters. A class has a set of operations or functions that it can perform to give you information about the String, or give you back a different String. Both Objects and primitives are created in my example at the start of a function. Its not that useful for me to dissect the code for you, this program is not heavily tested, so, go ahead and break it and tell me about it. Programming requires a break and fix mentality. The best code is code that does not need a lot of comments. If a block of code has a purpose, it is best to put it in its own function even if it gets called only once. Simplicity and clarity are traits of good code, tricky convoluted programs might be interesting, but its not good when you discover there is a bug.

Firstly, an XSL file is a valid XML file. Secondly, there is a lot of information on XSL. Again, w3schools and zvon is really all you need for learning and reference. The goal of the XSL is to transform the XML into HTML. Its not typical html though, its HTML without formatting. The html tags are logical partitions of the data we want to choose from the XML. The XSL file uses a LINK tag to link to the style sheet (CSS).

entry.title: Resurrecting an Emachine
entry.summary: Using Ubuntu Linux to recover files from corrupt hard drive. Emachine recover.

content.p: I was faced with a computer that would not boot at all, safe mode or otherwise. But there was a lot of valuable pictures on the computer. I am not one to take apart a computer and plug the hard drive into another working computer, to me, this is a very last measure. I am a software person, not a hardware person, so if I can solve the problem using software that is my first choice.
The first task was to recover the photos and documents. I used a regular Ubuntu Linux install iso image. Instead of installing Linux at the first boot menu I selected "Try Ubuntu"

It mounted the Windows partiton no problem and I found the picures, but what I did not realize was that I could not take the Linux disc out of the tray so that I could burn the files onto another disc. Fortunately the computer had an SD card slot. I could also used the customers camera as an external hard drive using usb.

After copying the photos to the SD card I wanted to hit a home run and slap Windows onto the computer using the Emachine recovery partion. I had recently fixed an HP desktop this way and that can be a very quick fix. But to no avail, the recovery partion on an Emachine is useless without a recovery cd.

All we had was the Windows sticker on the side of the box. Then I downloaded a copy of Windows – the same edition that was listed on the sticker, burnt it to disc and installed it. You can download Windows from some torrent sites though I am not sure it is legal. But since we have the sticker on the computer I felt like we had paid for Windows for this computer once already.

However there was some major problems with the Windows CD, firstly there where no drivers, so I had no sound, no internet. I was working behind the clock now and I was thinking I might run out of gas trying to fix Windows. I also knew that Linux would be able to tell me what I needed to know about the hardware. Installing Linux on her computer was a godsend. It told me what her hardware was. Once I knew that i was able to download the drivers and put them into the Windows partition from the working Linux. Also, I knew if I did not finish fixing her windows up she would have a working Linux system.

After I got the Windows drivers installed, I had to patch up the system so that it was usable and would not self destruct (like the original system). So there was Windows updates to get the current Internet Explorer and MSN. Also you can get a free copy of spyware doctor from google that has an anti-virus in it as well. I also put ccleaner on there so the system will not bloat and become slow. I also put a firewall on there, which oddly enough came with her network card driver from Nvidia. Thats it!
